jobs.title: Product Manager - Logistics and Delivery
jobs.about_us: Carousell is the leading classifieds group in Greater Southeast Asia on a mission to inspire the world to start selling, and to make secondhand the first choice. Founded in August 2012 in Singapore, the group has a leading presence in eight markets under the brands Carousell, Mudah.my, Cho Tot, OneKyat and Ox Street, serving tens of millions of monthly active users. We have three technology development centres in Singapore, Taiwan and India, as well as offices in Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia, Myanmar, and Vietnam. Carousell is backed by leading investors, including Telenor Group, Rakuten Ventures, Naver, STIC Investments and Sequoia Capital India.
jobs.job_description: Product Vision for Logistics and Delivery Our vision is for a world where selling and buying secondhand is a natural first choice for everyone. As more Carousell users seek convenient ways to transact online, your role would be to help design the product strategy which introduces convenient options for both buyers and sellers to ship items listed on Carousell across categories and regions. This may include integrating shipping partner solutions into Carousell’s product to give sellers maximum choice of fast, economical and delightful shipping options or focus on designing a streamlined flow for buyers to receive their items as effectively as possible. About The Role We are looking for an experienced product manager to lead the domain strategy for the shipping and delivery experience for buyers and sellers. You will play a hands-on role in creating a world-class post-sales platform experience for buyers and sellers in your domain. For example, seamless and transparent return shipping options reducing cost and inquiries. This opportunity will give you the chance to shape the vision of how shipping solutions are integrated into Carousell’s application from an early stage and build a better C2C marketplace across 8 different countries in South East Asia. You’ll work with an Engineering Manager, a team of Software Engineers, a Product Designer, and plus guidance of cross-functional leaders and data analysis within the reCommerce group at Carousell. The role reports to a Senior Product Manager (reCommerce), and is based in Singapore. You will: Single-handedly define the product strategy and vision for the next generation of Carousell’s shipping experience for buyers and sellers. Combine internal usage data, category manager and user research to validate key user problems and breakthrough opportunities that can deliver impact here and now Lead product discovery with designers, engineers and business stakeholders to identify and solve for user value, usability, technical and business risks. Transform user problems into validated solutions using technology, data science and analytics, support processes and marketplace policies. Champion ruthless prioritization, drive stakeholder alignment, and proactively manage risks & dependencies. Measure impact of initiatives, decide and communicate success or failure, identify key learnings and integrate them in overall user, product & feature understanding. Use Carousell as a place to continually develop yourself by working on innovations and user-focused solutions in a fast paced, fun environment through feedback and metrics Inspire the team to dream big and innovate to delight users. Drive product launches, partnering with business stakeholders to prepare high quality training plans, branding and marketing materials, and user communication.
jobs.job_requirements: You have: 5+ years of industry experience, including 3+ years of Product Management experience for a technology company, preferably in the logistics or delivery domain in e-commerce marketplaces Track record of successfully solving complex and ambiguous problems. User obsession and empathy. Demonstrate your passion about user experience. Analytical skills to understand & generate insights from user data. Fluency querying and working with data Focus on impact and results. You work on the right things, and lead them to closure. Drive and resourcefulness to persevere and overcome obstacles achieving challenging goals. Strong product and business judgement. Willingness and ability to take smart risks and fail forward. Ability to think, speak and write succinctly and clearly. High integrity and ability to positively collaborate with others. Bachelor’s degree, with strong academic record, in Computer Science or a related field such as Math, Physics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, or Business Administration. Masters preferred. Good to have: Experience working on C2C products.

jobs.title: OS Product Manager
jobs.about_us: What We Offer: Competitive salary Work visa & relocation support Creative, fast-paced working environment Opportunity to work on flagship mobile products seen by millions Career growth in a leading tech company
jobs.job_description: Job Responsibilities: Responsible for product planning and version iteration management of Transsion software functions and application products Follow up the entire process from product planning to launch, and actively explore user needs and business improvement points Fully understand users, optimize the overall experience and process from the user's perspective, and be able to independently complete target decomposition and path planning Through product research, data analysis, and competitive product analysis, deeply understand industry changes and user needs, and implement and promote product implementation Continuously monitor and analyze product user feedback and usage data to continuously improve user experience
jobs.job_requirements: Qualifications: Bachelor degree or above, more than 5 years of product experience Work experience, with a certain degree of work stress resistance Clear logic, structured thinking ability, in-depth understanding of business models, user needs, and operation strategies, and the ability to quickly grasp the main problems Good product sense, deep insight into user psychology or demands, deep thinking and self-denial habits, and the ability to actively discover and solve problems Good communication, learning ability and innovative spirit, able to quickly understand business goals, have ideas, persistence, and can be implemented Those with rich experience in mobile phone use are preferred Willing to relocate to and work onsite in Shanghai & Noida (visa support provided)

jobs.title: Product Manager (FX)
jobs.about_us: EMQ is a financial technology company that enables businesses of every size to access real-time, affordable, and efficient cross-border payments in 170+ markets. Through our API-powered platform, we continue to simplify global payments for our customers and enable them to scale efficiently across multiple markets. Recognized as a Tech Pioneer by World Economic Forum and Top 100 Cross-Border Payment Companies by FXC Intelligence, EMQ remains committed to fostering a more sustainable world by making financial services more accessible and inclusive for everyone, everywhere. EMQ has offices in Taiwan, Singapore, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Indonesia, and Dubai. The company is currently licensed in Hong Kong, Singapore, Indonesia, and registered as a Money Service Business in Canada. www.emq.com. If you are seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting financial services, come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!
jobs.job_description: The Role As the Product Manager (FX), you will be responsible for defining, ensuring viability, and successful delivery of EMQ’s FX value proposition. You will be working closely with our customers, Sales, internal Treasury team and the other Product Managers, to define and deliver outcomes that solve customer problems and grow business revenues. To be successful in this role, you must work effectively across different functions – including Product, FinOps & Treasury, Engineering, BD/Sales, Marketing, Operations – to deliver product outcomes that delight and exceed our customer’s expectations. What you’ll be doing… Proactively identify business opportunities and improvements to our FX product offerings and that solve customer problems and deliver revenue to the business Translate and explain the "What" & “Why” so that the Stakeholders can determine the appropriate "How" Define FX products and features with clearly defined outcomes, business value and metrics and work with Engineering Managers to produce Epics and prioritised detailed Features for the engineering teams. Establish and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, focussing on a clear understanding of their challenges and opportunities. Support effective product go to market and sales enablement activities by producing product collateral, guides, documentation and delivering sales and operational training Be customer obsessed, understand and clearly document their pain points, needs and requirements. Stay abreast of relevant markets, emerging technologies, innovations, and payment trends.
jobs.job_requirements: What we’re looking for… You have experience (3-5 years) running, designing or developing FX products and services for FinTechs or other Financial Institutions You have experience working well with product designers and software engineers You have a background in finance and/or tech You’re motivated by the opportunity to deliver high quality enterprise solutions to your customers & users You have excellent organizational skills You have solid leadership and communication skills A deep understanding of FX, payments and associated technologies Great interpersonal and communication skills An effective and proactive communicator in both written and spoken English

jobs.title: Digital Product Manager
jobs.job_description:
This role is to lead the end-to-end lifecycle of digital products, from ideation to delivery and optimization. Requires strong business acumen, cross-functional leadership, and a passion for delivering impactful digital solutions.

Job Scope
- Act as a strategic partner to business stakeholders, aligning product initiatives with organizational goals and customer needs.
- Lead and inspire cross-functional teams, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.
- Own the full product lifecycle including discovery, planning, development, launch, and post-launch optimization.
- Drive complex projects with precision, ensuring timely delivery, risk mitigation, and stakeholder alignment.
- Build and maintain robust business cases to support product investments, and track performance against KPIs.
- Oversee product budgets, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and cost control.
- Manage relationships with external vendors and partners to ensure quality and timely delivery of services and solutions.
- Prepare and deliver impactful presentations to senior leadership and stakeholders, articulating product vision, progress, and outcomes.
- Work closely with IT teams including Solution Delivery, Service Delivery and Analytics to ensure seamless technical execution.
- Conduct product demos, ad-hoc training sessions, and onboarding activities to drive adoption and user engagement.
jobs.job_requirements:
Skills & Qualifications
- Bachelor’s degree in business, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
- Minimum 5 years’ experience in digital product management, with a proven track record of delivering end-to-end product solutions.
- Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
- Proficiency in product management tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence, Aha!) and presentation software (e.g., PowerPoint).
- Ability to work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders across business and technology domains.

jobs.title: APAC Digital Platform Product Manager #117300
jobs.job_description:
Ensure end-to-end requirements for our Digital banking app platforms are gathered and analyzed for various product topics under your ownership
Handle and actively participate and contribute to all phases of the product lifecycle.
Work closely with the users, line management, and IT groups throughout the various phases of a topic
Partner with key business stakeholders to align and maintain the product vision
Engage stakeholders by providing updates through informal or formal meetings and ensure any decisions required are consulted by all key stakeholders
Identify risks, dependencies and issues and drive respective mitigations
Ensure compliance with established guidelines for accurate and timely project delivery milestones
Assist in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results with the help of SME / work stream leads for integration, user acceptance testing
Ensure compliance with established guidelines for accurate and timely project delivery milestones
Define and implement the automation strategy and platform vision for key processes
jobs.job_requirements:
You have work experience of at least 5 years in either the financial services or consulting industry.
Your experience of working in change for various systems and processes is preferred.
You have driven change management and/or process re-engineering efforts.
You have proven business analysis skills, including business and functional specification development.
You have strong attention to detail and demonstrate a results oriented mindset.

jobs.title: Associate Product Manager - IIT/IIM/BITS (2-4 yrs)
jobs.about_us: We are a young team of highly motivated & experienced individuals. We have a fun, creative and open culture. Commitment & integrity, consumer focus, innovation and team work are the pillars on which the organization is being built and what we care most about. We believe in the power of team work and would like to build a world class team which delivers the best to help us achieve our goals.
jobs.job_description: Ability to solve complex issues to achieve objectives and deliver results on multiple projects in a complex, fast-moving environment. Should have worked on the transaction products i,e eCommerce. Strong strategy, analytical, and communication skills. Contagious can-do attitude and self-sufficient work style. Gather detailed functional requirements and create product requirement (PRDs) and other documents to support rapid development and effectively manage trade-offs between costs/schedules versus customer benefits Proven ability to work in cross-functional environments including sales, marketing, business management, customer support and engineering teams. Provide analytics based insights to help marketing team optimize marketing spends Responsibilities will include understanding requirements, helping to define a product vision and strategy, and working with engineers to execute it. Assume ownership of products including defining scope and developing requirements for new and advanced products as well as upgrades and progressive releases for existing products. Champion customer satisfaction by working with customer support team, oversee customer grievance resolution and trouble shoot in case of escalations.
jobs.job_requirements: Qualification/ Experience/ Training MBA / BE qualified individuals with good academic pedigree. ( IIT/BITS/IIMS is preferred for BTech) Experience from Online/ Internet based firms At least 2 year experience as a APM/PM Desired Competencies Entrepreneurial - Business savvy, visionary, inspirational, Willing to take calculated risks Learner - flexible, open to ideas and change, grows with growth Fundamentally sound - Technically and functionally competent, is intelligent and has an analytical mindset Winner with energy & drive - Athletic, competitive and result oriented, a doer, an achiever. Managerial Courage - direct, fair and forthright, is respected Team builder - Team player, a talent identifier and team developer.

jobs.title: Product Manager-Mid-Back Product｜产品经理—中后台产品(Graduate Program)
jobs.job_description: Participate in the planning, design and optimization of the company's mid- and back-end products, and promote the implementation and realization of products. Collect and analyze business needs, write product requirement documents (PRDs), and work closely with the R&D team to ensure that products are launched on time. Track product usage, conduct data analysis, identify optimization points, and continuously improve product experience.
jobs.job_requirements: Educational Background: Bachelor's degree or above, finance, economics, management, computer science, engineering or other related majors are preferred. Language requirements: Good English listening, speaking, reading and writing skills, able to read and write project-related English documents and communicate effectively with multinational teams. Soft traits: Strong logical thinking and problem-solving skills, good time management skills, able to reasonably arrange work priorities and handle multiple tasks. Strong execution and sense of responsibility, able to ensure that tasks are completed on time, and can actively promote project progress. Strong learning and adaptability, able to quickly absorb new knowledge and cope with changes in a fast-paced work environment.

jobs.title: Digital Product Manager
jobs.about_us: Avocado Guild is recognized as one of the earliest web3 gaming guilds working closely with blockchain games. The company was first established in 2021 and grew to become the largest web3 gaming guild, providing benefits for communities in SEA via gaming opportunities. Over time we’ve evolved to become a leading web3 gaming incubator, dedicated to building out the sector via strategic investments, game design, community building, and infrastructure development. Our goal is to empower and educate the public about blockchain technology and opportunities through web3 Gaming. We are venture capital-backed by leading investors such as Animoca Brands, Solana Ventures, and Polygon Ventures just to name a few. The company is well-equipped to navigate and evolve within the sector of Blockchain technology with a focus on gaming.
jobs.job_description: ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES: Strategic Development: Collaborate with the COO and Head of Engineering to craft and execute sprint plans that drive our business objectives forward. Documentation and Specification: Take charge of documenting product scopes in Jira, using multimedia tools such as videos and wireframes, alongside comprehensive summaries to ensure clarity of product features for the development team. Quality Assurance: Oversee the creation of detailed test cases for each user story to facilitate effective QA processes. Sprint Management: Work closely with the development team to maintain sprint schedules, addressing any roadblocks promptly. Data-Driven Design: Employ data analytics to strategically design and refine product features, significantly enhancing user engagement and satisfaction. Continuous Improvement: Spearhead enhancements in our product design, delivery, and QA processes. Ownership: Manage the complete product delivery cycle, from design through testing to launch, ensuring excellence at every stage. Market Analysis: Conduct comprehensive market research and competitive analysis to inform product strategy and positioning. Customer Interaction: Engage directly with customers through interviews and feedback sessions to derive insights that shape product features and strategies. Roadmap Development: Develop and maintain a clear product roadmap, aligning product milestones with strategic business goals. Strategic Impact: Contribute to the broader strategic planning of the company, shaping how product initiatives support business growth.
jobs.job_requirements: CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS: Strategic Experience: Minimum of 5 years in product management, with a proven track record of strategic planning and lifecycle management in the tech or gaming industries. Agile and QA Proficiency: Expertise in managing agile development sprints and using project management tools such as Jira. Experience in overseeing quality assurance processes and ensuring alignment with product specifications. Advanced Analytical and Market Research Skills: Demonstrated capability in data analysis and feature optimization through A/B testing. Strong skills in conducting market analysis and competitive research to inform product strategy. Customer Engagement Expertise: Extensive experience in directly interacting with customers, conducting user research, and integrating feedback to enhance product development. Technical and Blockchain Proficiency: Proficiency in using advanced product management tools such as Confluence, and ClickUp. Knowledge of blockchain technology, particularly as it applies to gaming, is highly advantageous. Leadership and Cross-functional Coordination: Highly disciplined and self-driven with proven leadership skills, capable of managing and coordinating cross-functional teams. Experience in developing and maintaining product roadmaps that align with business objectives. Organizational and Communication Skills: Exceptional organizational and documentation skills, combined with the ability to communicate effectively across teams and with senior management. Demonstrated ability to articulate product visions, decisions, and strategic priorities clearly and persuasively.

jobs.title: Technical Product Manager
jobs.job_description:
I. Job Responsibilities
1、Be responsible for AMEA area Products management, you need to travel to Thailand, India, Indonesia, Vietnam, Bangladesh, etc.
2、Take charge of the life - cycle management of the assigned product lines, including new product development, product pricing, profit management, and achieving sales targets.
3、Be responsible for collecting market information, industry trends, and customer needs, determine the product development direction, and collaborate with the R&D team to develop new products and upgrade existing products.
4、Organize the technical documentation of the assigned products, formulate solutions, conduct internal training, engage in external technical exchanges, promote products, follow up on factory samples, and handle customer issues.
5、Provide research directions for application research on products or process technologies based on market demands, and guide the laboratory's application research work.
jobs.job_requirements:
II. Qualifications
1、A bachelor's degree or above in dyeing and finishing related majors.
2、More than 5 years of work experience in the printing and dyeing industry, with a good understanding of pretreatment or post - treatment processes. Preference will be given to those with product manager experience in international auxiliaries companies.
3、Have a strong sense of enterprise, be willing to take on challenges, be good at communication, possess excellent organizational and communication skills as well as teamwork spirit.
4、Those with good English skills are preferred.
5、Preference will be given to those with product manager experience in printing and OBA auxiliaries product management.

jobs.title: Technical Product Manager
jobs.job_description:
Technical Product Manager (Contract – Remote) Our firm is seeking a Technical Product Manager to lead the coordination, execution, and delivery of our client-facing platform. This role bridges the gap between engineering and business stakeholders, helping the team prioritise effectively and build with clarity. The position is fully remote and offered on a contract basis, with a competitive hourly rate.

Key Responsibilities
- Work closely with engineering, design, and leadership to define and prioritise product features
- Translate business requirements into clear technical specifications and user stories
- Manage the product backlog and ensure alignment with overall roadmap and delivery timelines
- Facilitate sprint planning, daily stand-ups, retrospectives, and cross-functional collaboration
- Identify risks, dependencies, and blockers, and proactively address them
- Ensure documentation is up to date and clear across design, development, and QA stages
- Monitor performance metrics post-launch and lead iteration cycles based on user and stakeholder feedback
jobs.job_requirements:
Qualifications
- Proven experience in a product management role, ideally in a startup or early-stage environment
- Technical background or familiarity with modern software development practices (agile, CI/CD, APIs, cloud infrastructure)
- Strong understanding of web application architecture and cross-functional team workflows
- Experience working with tools such as Jira, Notion, or Linear for backlog and sprint management
- Exceptional communication and organisational skills
- Ability to work independently in a remote environment while maintaining close alignment with engineering and leadership teams

Nice to Have
- Experience working on developer-facing products or internal tooling
- Familiarity with Figma or participation in early UI/UX collaboration
- Exposure to performance monitoring, analytics, or A/B testing tools
- Ability to conduct basic user research or stakeholder interviews

jobs.title: Technology Product Manager (Shopify)
jobs.about_us: GoDigital is a dynamic and innovative conglomerate at the intersection of music, media and technology. Our company was founded in 2006 by Jason Peterson, who is our CEO and Chairman and oversees all of the business unit groups. GoDigital is dedicated to building an ecosystem that inspires happiness by connecting consumers with content, community, and commerce at their passion points. Joining GoDigital means becoming part of a forward-thinking, passionate team dedicated to redefining the media and technology landscape. If you're enthusiastic about innovation, creativity, and making a tangible impact, GoDigital offers an exciting and fulfilling environment. Our values: Commitment: We strive for excellence, empower others, reject complacency, deliver exceptional value, and aim to make the world happier daily. Flourishing: We pursue continuous growth to align our work with what we love, excel at, and what the organization needs. Integrity & Fairness: We promote a meritocracy where equity, inclusion, and honesty are paramount, and everyone’s voice matters. No Fear: We make bold, rational decisions, embrace failure as a learning process, and manage risks effectively. Leading from Behind: We foster self-worth beyond job success, prioritize the organization and others, and believe leaders eat last.
jobs.job_description: Are you a tech-savvy eCommerce expert who loves building and optimizing seamless online shopping experiences? Do you know Shopify inside out and have a knack for connecting the dots between product, supply chain, and performance? If so, this is your chance to step into a high-impact role where your ideas will shape the future of our Commerce team. We’re looking for a Technology Product Manager based to own the technical side of our eCommerce platform. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our Shopify sites are not just functional - but fast, flexible, and fine-tuned for growth. This is a dynamic opportunity to bring your skills in product management, Shopify customization, supply chain logic, and SEO together under one roof. If you thrive in fast-paced environments and love taking products from good to great, we want to hear from you. Principal Accountabilities Own the setup, maintenance, and optimization of Shopify eCommerce websites across multiple brands. Collaborate with design, marketing, and supply chain teams to launch and enhance product offerings online. Implement and manage integrations between Shopify and third-party tools (inventory, shipping, CRM, etc.). Own the setup, operation, and optimization of eCommerce marketing tools such as Iterable, Klaviyo, and Mailchimp Identify opportunities for automation and streamline eCommerce workflows. Monitor site performance and customer experience, proactively recommending improvements. Stay ahead of eCommerce trends and Shopify updates to ensure best-in-class site performance.
jobs.job_requirements: Skills and Experience Required 3+ years of experience managing or developing Shopify eCommerce sites (custom themes, apps, integrations). Strong understanding of supply chain operations and their impact on eCommerce. Hands-on experience with Shopify Liquid, APIs, and third-party app ecosystems. Hands-on experience with Klaviyo, Iterable or equivalent email and cross-channel marketing platforms Familiarity with SEO best practices and implementation across eCommerce platforms. Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive, solution-oriented mindset. Strong communication and project management skills, comfortable working with remote, cross-functional teams.

jobs.title: Project Manager, Product Management Division
jobs.about_us: The Project Manager is responsible for the overall success of a project by ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within budget, meet business requirements and comply with IT governance framework, including security and resilience. The successful candidate will be a member of the IDA Government Digital Services, Product Management Division.
jobs.job_description: Responsibilities (System Development) Project Management Able to ensure that projects are executed based on the project plan to meet identified business needs, within agreed parameters of cost, duration and quality Able to develop project schedule and activities based on appropriate project implementation methodology Able to identify potential project risks and its implication to the organisation and to recommend mitigating measures so as to manage the risks and to provide reasonable assurance to the organisation Able to establish the appropriate project organisation structure and define the change management and communication plan to engage and set expectations of stakeholders Able to effectively engage and manage the External Service Provider(s) (who supplies the people, processes, tools and methodologies) to deliver ICT solutions and services This includes procurement, contract management and transition management Able to understand the IT management policy, quality management policy and security guidelines to ensure the development processes and procedures and system are designed to comply with these policy and guidelines Able to communicate and present to senior decision makers, stakeholders and management forums on project progress and issues with respect to business objectives. Contract and Service Provider Management Able to manage the life cycle of the contract from contract initiation, transition , expiry or termination & handover Able to perform relationship management and dispute management Able to manage Service Provider's quality and performance to ensure that services are delivered according to the specified service levels and requirements including systems maintenance, enhancements, problem resolution and improvements ICT Funding and Procurement Able to understand the business objective and needs, plan and lead the development of a feasible business case and budget for the ICT system Able to understand the sources of funding and their review cycle to develop action plan to obtain funding Able to understand the principles, values and rules of procurement policy and execute the procurement process in compliance to the established procedure and guidelines Able to manage and execute the procurement life cycle - procurement approach, specifications, evaluation & clarification, recommendation and contracting in a timely and quality manner Responsibilities (System Maintenance) Able to plan and develop strategy for system maintenance to meet the business objectives Able to establish the appropriate project structure and define the communication plan for various stakeholders Able to plan and implement operation processes and procedures to manage the day to day operation of the system to meet the business operation objectives on systems availability Able to manage project costs, including change requests/service requests, to ensure that projects achieve their planned benefits within budget Able to manage project risks in a timely manner to ensure impact is mitigated Able to understand the IT management policy, quality management policy and security guidelines to ensure maintenance processes and procedures are designed to comply with these policy and guidelines. Able to communicate and present to senior decision makers, stakeholders and management forums on system operations and issues with respect to business objectives.
jobs.job_requirements: Requirements Graduate Degree in Computer/Computer Science or Electronics Engineering or Information Technology or equivalent Minimum five to seven years of working experience Hands-on experience in at least one full project development life cycles Advantageous to have: Project Management Experience Project Management related certification such as CITPM, COMIT or PMI Prior experience working in a product management environment Government ICT project delivery experience Public-facing digital services experience Vendor management or sub-contractor management experience Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem solving skills Results and customer oriented Team player with strong organization and people management skills Excellent written, verbal communication, presentation and negotiation skills

jobs.title: Production Manager
jobs.job_description: JOB PURPOSE Responsible for production of active pharmaceutical ingredients and operation of the related environmental control systems, ensuring company objectives and targets are met with respect to output, quality, environment, health and safety. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES 1. Manage the production facilities to manufacture active pharmaceutical ingredients on schedule and meeting all regulatory, quality and supply chain requirements. 2. Ensure appropriate activity reporting (weekly) and KPIs monitoring (monthly) for : a) Production planning b) Yields and cycle time c) Operational safety and hygiene at the plant d) Projects 3. Deliver production planning and production capacities assessments with appropriate tools for budget, long-range planning purposes and according to specific management requests. 4. Continually advise and ensure completion of improvement projects on all aspects of process engineering and chemistry in coordination with PD Aramon and local partners 5. Drive and facilitate the implementation of the new Lean culture and associated performance improvement initiatives in the production area in close coordination with other departments. 6. Ensure adequate in-process testing and to interpret analytical results and ensure the appropriate course of action for the manufacturing process. 7. Develop and ensure that adequate and appropriate procedural documents and proper records are maintained and updated to ensure operating success. 8. Ensure effective operation of the site biological waste treatment process and scrubber and plant extraction system. 9. Contribute to effective operation of the site biological waste treatment process. 10. Prepare annual departmental budget in collaboration with finance, review costs and contribute to improvements for operational effectiveness. 11. Is responsible, with the contribution of HR, for the development of the human capital of the department in recruitment, training, aspiration and retention. 12. Lead and motivate the department personnel towards continuous improvement in all aspects of the site operations (eg. EHS, Quality, cGMP, IS security, and waste minimisation) and contribute to the company’s initiatives (eg LEAN program). 13. Ensure close coordination with Engineering, ISPCS, IQC, Logistics leaders and other site departments in carrying out production tasks and projects implementation. 14. Ensure the safety of plant personnel through promoting awareness and compliance with health, safety, environmental regulations and requirements. 15. Develop and implement training programs, conduct training and ensure training records are maintained. 16. Comply with all global and local policies and defined procedures and regulations within the jobholder’s responsibilities
